verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite<WH5284>, and said<WH559>,
Therefore do my thoughts<WH5587> cause me to answer<WH7725>, and for this I make haste<WH2363>.
I have heard<WH8085> the check<WH4148> of my reproach<WH3639>, and the spirit<WH7307> of my understanding<WH998> causes me to answer<WH6030>.
Know<WH3045> you not this of old<WH5703>, since man<WH120> was placed<WH7760> upon earth<WH776>,
That the triumphing<WH7445> of the wicked<WH7563> is short<WH7138>, and the joy<WH8057> of the hypocrite<WH2611> but for a moment<WH7281>?
Though his excellency<WH7863> mountain up<WH5927> to the heavens<WH8064>, and his head<WH7218> reach<WH5060> unto the clouds<WH5645>;
Yet he shall perish<WH6> for ever<WH5331> like his own dung<WH1561>: they which have seen<WH7200> him shall say<WH559>, Where is he<WH335>?
He shall fly away<WH5774> as a dream<WH2472>, and shall not be found<WH4672>: Yes<WH5074>, he shall be chased away as a vision<WH2384> of the night<WH3915>.
The eye<WH5869> also which saw<WH7805> him shall see him no more<WH3254>; neither shall his place<WH4725> any more behold him<WH7789>.
His sons<WH1121> shall seek to please<WH7521> the poor<WH1800>, and his hands<WH3027> shall restore<WH7725> their goods<WH202>.
His bones<WH6106> are full<WH4390> of the sin of his youth<WH5934>, which shall lie down<WH7901> with him in the dust<WH6083>.
Though wickedness<WH7451> be sweet<WH4985> in his mouth<WH6310>, though he hide<WH3582> it under his tongue<WH3956>;
Though he spare<WH2550> it<WH5800>, and forsake it not<WH4513>; but keep it still inside<WH8432> his mouth<WH2441>:
Yet his food<WH3899> in his bowels<WH4578> is turned<WH2015>, it is the gall<WH4846> of asps<WH6620> inside him<WH7130>.
He has swallowed down<WH1104> riches<WH2428>, and he shall vomit them up again<WH6958>: God<WH410> shall cast them out<WH3423> of his belly<WH990>.
He shall suck<WH3243> the poison<WH7219> of asps<WH6620>: the viper<WH660>'s tongue<WH3956> shall kill him<WH2026>.
He shall not see<WH7200> the rivers<WH6390>, the floods<WH5104>, the brooks<WH5158> of honey<WH1706> and butter<WH2529>.

That which he labored<WH3022> for shall he restore<WH7725>, and shall not swallow it down<WH1104>: according to his substance<WH2428> shall the restitution<WH8545> be<WH5965>, and he shall not rejoice in it.
Because he has oppressed<WH7533> and has forsaken<WH5800> the poor<WH1800>; because he has violently taken away<WH1497> an house<WH1004> which he built not<WH1129>;
Surely he shall not feel<WH3045> quietness<WH7961> in his belly<WH990>, he shall not save<WH4422> of that which he desired<WH2530>.
There shall none of his food<WH400> be left<WH8300>; therefore shall no man look<WH2342> for his goods<WH2898>.
In the fullness<WH4390> of his sufficiency<WH5607> he shall be in straits<WH3334>: every hand<WH3027> of the wicked<WH6001> shall come upon him<WH935>.
When he is about to fill<WH4390> his belly<WH990>, God shall cast<WH7971> the fury<WH2740> of his wrath<WH639> upon him<WH4305>, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating<WH3894>.
He shall flee<WH1272> from the iron<WH1270> weapon<WH5402>, and the bow<WH7198> of steel<WH5154> shall strike him through<WH2498>.
It is drawn<WH8025>, and comes out<WH3318> of the body<WH1465>; Yes<WH1300>, the glittering sword comes out<WH1980> of his gall<WH4846>: terrors are upon him<WH367>.

All darkness<WH2822> shall be hid<WH2934> in his secret places<WH6845>: a fire<WH784> not blown<WH5301> shall consume<WH398> him<WH3415>; it shall go ill with him that is left<WH8300> in his tabernacle<WH168>.
The heaven<WH8064> shall reveal<WH1540> his iniquity<WH5771>; and the earth<WH776> shall rise up against him<WH6965>.
The increase<WH2981> of his house<WH1004> shall depart<WH1540>, and his goods shall flow away<WH5064> in the day<WH3117> of his wrath<WH639>.
This is the portion<WH2506> of a wicked<WH7563> man<WH120> from God<WH430>, and the heritage<WH5159> appointed<WH561> unto him by God<WH410>.
